meanings.definition: (verb) to make a low, soft sound like a horse
meanings.sent1: The horse was whickering softly in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I heard the horses whickering in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The whickering of the horse sounded like a gentle whisper.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the whickering of the horses filled the air with tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The whickering of the horse was a soothing melody in the peaceful barn.

meanings.definition: (noun) a low, soft sound made by a horse
meanings.sent1: The whickering of the horse was calming to listen to.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the gentle whickering of the horses in the stable.
meanings.sent3: The whickering of the horse seemed to be its way of saying hello.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet night, the whickering of the horses echoed through the fields.
meanings.sent5: The whickering of the horse was like a secret language only understood by other horses.
